title: Midwestern American Slang
description: How well do you know the friendly expressions of America's Heartland?

questions.question: In the Midwest, what does 'ope' express?
What does 'pop' refer to in the Midwest?
In Midwestern English, what does 'you betcha' mean?
options: You're absolutely right / Yes, of course

questions.question: What does 'hotdish' refer to in the Upper Midwest?
options: A casserole or baked one-dish meal

questions.question: In the Midwest, what is a 'bubbler'?
What does 'the Midwest goodbye' refer to?
options: An extended, prolonged farewell that can last 30+ minutes

questions.question: In Midwestern English, what does 'come with' mean (as in 'Do you want to come with?')?
What is a 'jello salad' in Midwestern culture?
options: A gelatin-based dish with fruit, vegetables, or other mix-ins served as a side

questions.question: In the Midwest, what does 'oh, for cute!' mean?
What does 'kitty-corner' (or 'catty-corner') mean in Midwestern English?
In the Midwest, what does 'could you borrow me' something mean?
What is a 'sack' in Midwestern grocery vocabulary?
In the Midwest, what does 'dontcha know' function as?
options: A conversational filler or emphasis phrase

questions.question: What does 'supper' typically mean in the Midwest (as distinct from 'dinner')?
options: The evening meal (dinner is the midday meal for some)

questions.question: In Midwestern English, what does 'real quick' mean in 'I'm gonna stop real quick'?
options: Briefly or for a short time
